required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Academic Translational Research Network for the Optimization of the Oncological Health Care Quality in the Adjuvant and Advanced/Metastatic Setting: Health Care Research, Pharmacogenomics, Biomarkers, Health Economics

brief_summary.textblock:
Among patients with breast cancer the subgroup of patients with metastases are considered the group of patients with the worst prognosis. Not only with regard to therapy decisions but also with regard to quality assured healthcare and health economics this entity of patients remains a challenge.
Recently, novel advances in breast cancer therapy aim at the targeted therapy of tumor entities and identification of patients, for whom the greatest therapy benefit and the least side effects are expected.
However molecular assessment of the patient and the tumor in the metastatic situation is not performed on a routine basis and in many cases tumor characteristics from the primary tumor are considered reliable enough to make therapy decisions for the metastatic patients. Although molecular reassessment of tumor characteristics from tumor material of the metastasis is recommended in national guidelines, only a minority of patients is biopsied, because of the invasiveness of the procedure, even though biopsy related complications are reported to be rare.
With modern analytic methods from blood based biomaterial there seems to be an opportunity to correlate blood based tumor assessments with actual characteristics of the tumor. These include expression analysis, tumor mutation analysis, tumor gene copy number abberations and others. One of the main aims of the PRAEGNANT study is therefore to establish an infrastructure for the comprehensive analysis of tumor and metastatic molecular characteristics of the patient and the tumor.
Furthermore the impact of health care related outcomes such as health economics novel approaches for integration of patients in study conduct and health care awareness are study aims of the PRAEGNANT study.

primary_outcome.measure: Discovery of biomarkers, which predict progression free survival (PFS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: PFS defined as the time to the first progression after study inclusion from the last time of progression before or at study entry
primary_outcome.description: Analyses will be done separately for each therapy line. Biomarkers include gene expression profiling of the primary tumor and the corresponding metastases, somatic mutations, germline genetic variation, epigenetic changes and miRNA variation up to a total of 500,000 biomarkers.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: OS is defined as the time to death from the date of the last progression before or at study entry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of breast cancer specific survival (BCSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BCSS is defined as the time to to death due to breast cancer from the date of the last progression before or at study entry.

secondary_outcome.description: Objective response is defined as the best-documented response to the therapy started at study entry or the last therapy started before study entry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of therapies used in the metastatic setting
secondary_outcome.description: Therapies will be categorized and descriptive statistics will be presented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with EORTC QlQ-C30 and Visual Analog Scala (VAS)
Defined as the percentage of therapies which are terminated as per patients' wish.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influencing Factors of Depression in patients with metastatic breast cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Depression will be assessed by CESD-R, completed by the patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events, serious adverse events will be reported.
secondary_outcome.description: According to NCI Common Toxicity Criteria Version 4.03.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of gene alterations (mutations and or amplifications) between primary tumor, metastatic tumor and circulating tumor DNA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ C-30 (Version 3.0) and actual documented costs of diagnostic procedures, therapies, treatment of side effects and care for tumour-associated symtoms will be used to calculate health care costs, quality adjusted life years (QALY) and incremental cost effectiveness ratios (ICER) between patient groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient reported influencing factors on therapy adherence in patients metastatic and/or locally advanced, inoperable breast cancer.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patient reported adherence for orally administered therapies will be assessed with questionnaires such as the Morisky Medical Adherence Scale 8 items (MMAS-8)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of women, who will receive results of molecular tests undertaken in the context of the scientific objectives of this trial.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who will receive molecular testing results compared to the total number of included patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility and satisfaction regarding receipt of molecular testing results (including hereditary genetic alterations)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a physician and patient questionnaire and documentation of possible confirmatory testing for changes in therapy or eligibility for interventional clinical trial screening.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of the incidence of depression with germline genetic variation and therapies and gene expression from leukocytes.
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: CESD-R values will be associated with blood biomarkers, single nucleotid polymorphisms and therapies.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of gene alterations (mutations and or amplifications) and gene expression between primary tumor and metastatic tumor for the prediction of side effects and prognosis.
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: DNA and RNA of the primary tumor will be extracted of archival formalin fixed, paraffin embedded tumor samples and analyzed mu-tations, mutation changes, and differentially expressed genes. Additionally FFPE will be used for the construction of a TMA for anti-body staining.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of gene alterations (mutations and or amplifications) and gene expression between primary tumor, metastatic tumor and circulating tumor cells (CTCs)
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: Circulating tumor cells (CTC) from selected patients will be analyzed for mutations and gene amplifications. Findings will be com-pared to mutations assessed from FFPE tu-mor material.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of gene alterations (mutations and or amplifications) between primary tumor, metastatic tumor and circulating tumor DNA
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: Circulating DNA (ctDNA) will be analyzed for genetic variation and compared to mutations assessed from FFPE tumor material.

other_outcome.measure: Prediction of therapy response, prognosis and side effects with germline Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: Germline DNA will be extracted and used as reference for the genetic analysis of the tumor, CTCs and ctDNA. Additionally genomewide SNPs will be assessed and used for a genomewide association study.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of blood protein biomarkers with side effects, and progression
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: EGFR (1068), HSP27 (pS78), IL-1a, IL-1b, IL-2, IL-6, Il-8, PAI-1, sEGFR, ERK1/2, mTOR, TNF-a, TNF-b. PINP, CTx, Vitamin D, OPG, RANKL

other_outcome.measure: Identification of risk factors for the development of metastatic disease in healthy women.
other_outcome.description: Patients will be matched to a pool of controls, which are not part of the PRAEGNANT study, but which have been recruited during the same time.

other_outcome.measure: Influencing Factors of Physical Activity, Mental factors and Nutrition in patients with metastatic breast cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Study entry and every 3 month or following a change of a therapy line, up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: Physical activity and nutrition will be assessed with patient reported questionnaires.

other_outcome.measure: Time to progression from the beginning of subsequent therapy lines until the next progression.
other_outcome.description: All molecular and other measures that might predict prognosis will be associated with the-se times to progression as well.

other_outcome.measure: Time to death from the beginning of subsequent therapy lines
other_outcome.description: All molecular and other measures that might predict prognosis will be associated with the-se times to death as well.

intervention.description: A blood sample will be taken during a routine blood draw

study_pop.textblock: 3500 patients with locally advanced/metastatic breast cancer in any line of treatment (e.g. 1st, 2nd, 3rd, or ≥ 4th line). A patient can only participate after providing informed consent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult women aged ≥18 years
- Patients with the diagnosis of invasive breast cancer (in German:
Mammakarzinom, as op-posed to "non-invasive"= ductales Carcinoma in situ; irrespective of status of BC, e.g. TNM, re-ceptor status etc.) and
- Patients, who are willing and able to sign the informed consent form
- Patients with metastatic or locally advanced, inoperable disease proven by clinical measures (i.e. standard imaging)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who did not sign the informed consent form
- Patients, who are not eligible for observation due to non-availability and/or severe comor-bidities as evaluated by the treating physician
- Patients who do not have the diagnosis of metastatic or locally advanced, inoperabe breast cancer

overall_official.affiliation: Nationales Centrum für Tumorerkrankungen (NCT) Sektion Gynäkologische Onkologie

facility.name: Frauenklinik und Poliklinik der Technischen Universität München

Institut für Versorgungsforschung in der Onkologie GbR
Klinik für Gynäkologie und Geburtshilfe, Helios Kliniken

link.description: Biomarkers in Patients with Metastatic Breast Cancer and the PRAEGNANT Study Network
